Description: Undyed linen textile decorated with tapestry-woven coloured wools: Artemis with bow and Actaeon(?) with reversed spear; red flowers in field; central dividing panel decorated with dancing male figures within scrolls(floral border); side panels decorated with dancing figures within vine-tendrils.
Curator's comments: Published: T. Phillips [ed.], Africa, London 1995, p. 579 [7.44] = T. Phillips [ed.], Afrika, Berlin 1996, p.579 [7.44]. Rutschowscaya, Coptic fabrics, 101 (reversed)
Bibliographic references: Badawy 1978 / Coptic art and archaeology (4.69, p.290)
Phillips 1996 / Africa: The Art of a Continent (7.44)
Exhibition history: 2023-2024 13 Nov-3 Mar, New York, Metropolitan Museum, Africa and Byzantium
